alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 9:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Georgetown and south central Williamsburg Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 927 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jamestown, or 21 miles northeast of Moncks Corner, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Andrews, North Santee, Lambert, Sampit, Graves, Warsaw, Earle, Oatland, and Georgetown Memorial Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
